medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation as a long-term survivor of testicular cancer.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient received curative therapy for testicular cancer at age 18. He has reported no significant changes in his health since then and has been in continuous remission since treatment at age 18. Follow-up care was neglected for the last 6 years due to a work-related move.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Testicular cancer diagnosed at age 18. Previous treatment included left inguinal orchiectomy and chemotherapy (bleomycin, etoposide, and cisplatin).
medical_history.social_history: The patient smokes one pack of cigarettes daily, drinks alcohol socially, is married with no children, and works as a computer programmer.
